name: Vereniging Nederlandse Verkeersvliegers
goal:
The following practical goals are characteristic of the VNV:

promoting the safety of aviation
creating good employment conditions
increasing the professional level of the airline pilots
promoting the individual interests of the members

The VNV achieves its goals with the support of around 3,500 members, almost all of whom are employed by Dutch airline companies. Various active members are also highly skilled in other areas. And so the VNV has a whole range of disciplines at its disposal, varying between technology and economy to medical aspects and accident analysis.
interests: Borders and Security, Competition, Foreign affairs and security policy, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: VNV follows the EU initiatives in the fields of Air Transport and Employment with an special interest in the EU external relations, the protection of EU air carriers against unfair competition from third countries, atypical employment and the protection of EU pilotâ€™s fundamental rights (including the right to collective bargaining and collective actions). We are also following the developments on free movement of workers and the coordination of social security.
